qas.question: The largest municipal healthcare in the US is what?

answers.text: New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation

qas.question: How many hospitals does HHC operate?
What is the yearly revenue of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation?
How many patients are served annually by HHC?
How many uninsured New Yorkers take advantage of HHC?
In what year was the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation founded?
How many nursing homes does HHC operate?

context: The <a0_0>New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation<a0_0/> (HHC) operates the public hospitals and clinics in New York City. A public benefit corporation with <a2_0>$6.7 billion<a2_0/> in annual revenues, HHC is the largest municipal healthcare system in the United States serving <a3_0>1.4 million<a3_0/> patients, including more than <a4_0>475,000<a4_0/> uninsured city residents. HHC was created in <a5_0>1969<a5_0/> by the New York State Legislature as a public benefit corporation (Chapter 1016 of the Laws 1969). It is similar to a municipal agency but has a Board of Directors. HHC operates <a1_0>11<a1_0/> acute care hospitals, <a6_0>five<a6_0/> nursing homes, six diagnostic and treatment centers, and more than 70 community-based primary care sites, serving primarily the poor and working class. HHC's MetroPlus Health Plan is one of the New York area's largest providers of government-sponsored health insurance and is the plan of choice for nearly half million New Yorkers.
